intro: Castilleja affinis var. linariifolia, commonly known as the slender milkvetch, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and has a root system that connects to the roots of other plants, drawing nutrients and water from them. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and sagebrush steppe. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are bright red or orange, arranged in dense clusters. This species plays a role in ecological interactions, influencing both its host plants and the broader ecosystem.
